bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM, GAME APPARATUS, SERVER, STORAGE MEDIUM STORING A PROGRAM, AND GAME CONTROL METHOD

abstract.p: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each of the game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's manual input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquires whether it is possible to communicate with an opponent in the friend list over the network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. Even if a user makes a short distance wireless communication with a friend to exchange and register the identifying information or registers the friend by hand and then is parted from the friend, the user can safely communicate with the opponent is to be added to the multiplayer game session, one of the participants transmits identifying information to introduce the communication opponents to each other. The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over a network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Communication game system, game apparatus, and game control method
Kommunikationsspielsystem, Spielvorrichtung und Spielsteuerungsverfahren
Système de jeu de communication, appareil de jeu et procédé de contrôle de jeu

nplcit.text: ANONYMOUS: "SIP/SIMPLE Presence Specification, OMA-PAG-SIMPLE-Spec-V1_0_0-20041118-D" OMA, 18 November 2004 (2004-11-18), XP002376929

abstract.p: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each of the game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquires server, etc. whether or not it is possible to communicate with the opponent in the friend list over a network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. In a case that a still another opponent being connected to its own apparatus exists, when other game apparatus makes a connection, its own game apparatus transmits their identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other.
The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over a network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.

abstract.p: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each of the game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's input in a friend list. bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a network game which is secure and easily attendable since communication is performed over a network with friends with which identifying information is exchanged.

SOLUTION: The communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each of the game apparatus registers the identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquires server, etc. whether or not it is possible to communicate with the opponent in the friend list over a network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. In a case that a still another opponent being connected to its own apparatus exists, when other game apparatus makes a connection, its own game apparatus transmits their identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other.
The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over the network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2007,JPO&INPIT

bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To realize a network game in which a network communication is possible with only a friend whose identifying information is registered, and with which it becomes possible to participate in a network game safely and easily.

SOLUTION: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other, for example. Each of the game apparatus registers identification information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquires, for example, server whether or not it is possible to communicate with the opponent in the friend list over the network. If it is determined that it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication.

In a case that a still another opponent being connected to its own apparatus exists, when other game apparatus makes a connection, its own game apparatus transmits their identification information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other. The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over the network, and add the identification information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2011,JPO&INPIT

bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a network game which is safe and easy to join since communication can be performed through a network with a friend with whom identification information is exchanged.

SOLUTION: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other, for example. The game apparatus registers the identification information of an opponent obtained by short-distance wireless communication or manual input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus is connected to the Internet, and inquires a server, for instance, whether or not it is possible to communicate with the opponent in the friend list over the network. When it is determined that it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains the address of the opponent to perform network communication. In the case that a still another opponent under the communication exists when connected from another game apparatus, the game apparatuses transmit their identification information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other. The introduced game apparatus communicates with the introduced opponent over the network, and adds the identification information of the opponent to the friend list, if necessary.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2012,JPO&INPIT

bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a communication game system which can realize a network game in which a network communication is possible with a friend whose identifying information is exchanged with a user and which can realize a network game in which users can safely and easily participate.

SOLUTION: A communication game system includes, for example, a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each of the game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquires server whether or not it is possible to communicate with the opponent in the friend list over a network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. In a case that a still another opponent being connected to its own apparatus exists, when other game apparatus makes a connection, its own game apparatus transmits their identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other. The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over a network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2012,JPO&INPIT

bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMMUNICATION GAME SYSTEM

abstract.p: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's manual input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquiries whether it is possible to communicate with an opponent in the friend list over the network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. Even if a user makes a short distance wireless communication with a friend to exchange and register the identifying information or registers the friend by hand and then is parted from the friend, the user can safely communicate with the friend across the network without being exposed to unknown players.

In a case that an additional opponent is to be added to the multiplayer game session, one of the participants transmits identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other. The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over the network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Communication game system, game apparatus, server, storage medium storing a program, and game control method

If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. In a case that a still another opponent being connected to its own apparatus exists, when other game apparatus makes a connection, its own game apparatus transmits their identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other.
The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over a network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.

abstract.p: A communication game system includes a plurality of game apparatuses which are able to wirelessly communicate with each other. Each game apparatus registers identifying information of an opponent obtained by a short-distance wireless communication or by user's manual input in a friend list. Thereafter, the game apparatus connects to the Internet, and inquiries whether it is possible to communicate with an opponent in the friend list over the network. If it is possible to communicate, the game apparatus obtains an address of the opponent to make a network communication. Even if a user makes a short distance wireless communication with a friend to exchange and register the identifying information or registers the friend by hand and then is parted from the friend, the user can safely communicate with the friend across the network without being exposed to unknown players.

In a case that an additional opponent is to be added to the multiplayer game session, one of the participants transmits identifying information to introduce the communicating opponents to each other. The game apparatuses introduced to each other make a communication over the network, and add the identifying information of the opponents to the friend list, if necessary.
